column4: So i have an ubuntu swap question: my system manager says using 0 out of 0, but the ram is completely used and the system is lagging.  What's the problem?
did you create a swap partition when you installed?
ahh, I think I know the problem, I moved a couple partitions around and might have renamed it.
so I have a swap, but it changed from sda5 to sda2, how do I update ubuntu
in /etc/fstab , change the partition that swap is expected on.  blkid in a terminal will tell you the uuid of your partitions
won't work, it's not a package in an ubuntu repo
try   sudo apt-get remove --purge <that package> , that will get rid of that file /etc/X11/Xsession.d/39keytouch-acpid
the real problem is the last line
I don't have the exact same error as this guy. Here's mine: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/61698/
put a copy of    gedit  ~/.profile    on http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
yea, I was looking at that but I have no clue how to fix it, thanksf or lookign at it
I have a generic replacement for you, that is so totally the wrong content for that file, a sec
OOOO i know what happened.  compiz saved its settings to that file.  thanks, the replacement will fix it
thanks for the help, talk to you later
well, I'm back anyways, and it did work.  thanks again
